abstract.text: Creates a geometry source from the specified data and options.

inlineContent.text: The data for the geometry source.
The semantic value (or attribute) that the geometry source describes for each vertex. See Geometry Semantic Identifiers for available values.
The number of geometry source vectors.
A Boolean value that indicates whether vector components are floating-point values. Specify
for floating-point values, or
for integer values.
The number of scalar components in each vector.
The size, in bytes, of each vector component.
The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the data to the first vector component to be used in the geometry source.
The number of bytes from each vector to the next in the data.
A new geometry source object.

A geometry sourceâ€™s data is an array of vectors, each of which represents a particular attribute (or semantic) of a vertex in the geometry. The other parameters determine how SceneKit interprets this data. For example, an array of vertex positions may have three 32-bit floating-point components per vector, but an array of texture coordinates may have two 8-bit integer coponents per vector. You can use the
and
parameters together to interleave data for multiple geometry sources in the same array, improving rendering performance. See
for details.
To create a custom
object from the geometry source, use the
method.

abstract.text: A false value.
A true value.
Create 3D games and add 3D content to apps using high-level scene descriptions, and easily add animations, physics simulation, particle effects, and realistic physically based rendering.
A three-dimensional shape (also called a model or mesh) that can be displayed in a scene, with attached materials that define its appearance.
Creates a new geometry built from the specified geometry sources and elements.
A container for vertex data forming part of the definition for a three-dimensional object, or geometry.
Creates a geometry source from an array of normal vectors.
Creates a geometry source from an array of texture coordinate points.
Creates a geometry source from an array of vertex positions.
Creates a geometry source from the specified data and options.
Creates a geometry source from an array of normal vectors.
Creates a geometry source from an array of texture coordinate points.
Creates a geometry source from an array of vertex positions.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Describes an integer.
A static byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A byte buffer in memory.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A signed integer value type.
